intro: Argyropsis candida, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its white to pale blue flowers. The plant has silver-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance. Argyropsis candida typically grows in open areas and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
